item.title: Submit Your March Madness Bracket Challenge NowüèÄ
item.description:
1 min.

<center>

March Madness Brackets!

Hi everyone! For those of you unable to attend our bracket making event, we are sharing the link so that you are still able to participate! One link will take you to the men‚Äôs bracket challenge, the other the women‚Äôs bracket challenge. Both of these need to be completed by March 20th in order to be eligible - the tournament starts March 21st so you will be unable to complete the bracket at this point.


The person with the best bracket in each tournament will win an awesome prize!!! So, fill out a bracket - you have nothing to lose!

Men‚Äôs Bracket

Password: SportsAnalytics1


Women‚Äôs Bracket

Password: SportsAnalytics0

For those interested in the details of the NCAA tournament, here is the link to the slideshow where we dove into the rating systems and how to create a good bracket - and what the odds are that you make the perfect bracket.


Link: https://www.canva.com/design/DAGhTNx8Kd0/ecioTtNMKjkdOtgICurcrg/edit?utm_content=DAGhTNx8Kd0&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=sharebutton

</center>

item.title: BUSAG Newsletter Vol 4
item.description:
2 min.

<center>

Updates for the Coming Weeks

Hello everyone! As we begin to wrap up the semester, we wanted to share the dates for our final few meetings/events of the year:


April 7th: General Meeting - The History of Analytics in HAR 419 from 6-7 pm

April 22nd/23rd: Potential Surprise Event (stay tuned)

April 24th: Career advice with Andy Andres (more on that below)

April 28th: General Meeting - Project Pitch Night


Times and locations will be announced closer to the dates as we are still reserving rooms and finalizing details with Questrom - keep an eye on our Instagram!

¬†

Career Advice with Andy Andres

Our club‚Äôs advisor Andy Andres will be joining us later this month to talk about his career path through sports and academia

Andy has degrees in Computer Science (AB, Brown), Physiology (MS, Harvard), and Nutritional Biochemistry and Physiology (PhD, Tufts)


He has held a variety of roles across disciplines, including Head Coach/Lead Instructor of The Science of Baseball Program at MIT, Master Lecturer at BU‚Äôs CGS, Visiting Lecturer at Tufts, Data Analyst for BaseballHQ.com, and Pitch Clock/Data caster at Fenway Park for the MLB. He has also won awards for his research on Tommy John surgery and pitch fx.


We have created a form for those who have questions ahead of time to help Andy prepare for his talk with us: Career Advice with Andy Andres

¬†

AthlyticZ Course Offerings

We as a club have been offered a 50% off discount on some Machine Learning courses lead by the Director of Predictive Modeling at the Philadelphia Phillies: Patrick McFarlane. The course has pre-recorded lessons and offers walk through demos and quizzes to help test your knowledge.

For those interested in learning more, here is the link to view the courses offered to us: https://athlyticz.com/affiliate-courses?am_id=michael3076

(the course title is ML in Sports)


If you are interested in purchasing the course with the discount, please reach out to busportsanalytics@gmail.com for the discount code.

¬†

Sports News Round-up!

March Madness Tournaments

The NCAA Women‚Äôs and Men‚Äôs March Madness tournaments are down to their final four teams.

The Women‚Äôs Final Four kicks things off on April 4th with UConn vs UCLA and South Carolina vs Texas the women‚Äôs final is set to be held on April 6th

The Men‚Äôs Final Four will follow the women‚Äôs on April 5th with Florida vs Auburn and Duke vs Houston


NFL Mock Draft Simulator

ESPN Analytics Team has launched an NFL Draft Day Predictor Model that estimates the chance that every prospect is taken at each pick. ESPN will be using this model throughout the draft to assist on their broadcast.


BU Makes Frozen Four

Our very own Boston University Terriers Men‚Äôs hockey team has made it to the NCAA Frozen Four for the third year in a row. Jay Pandolfo between his four-year playing career at BU and three years as head coach has made it to the tournament every year. BU will be facing off on April 10th against Penn State, who will appear in the Frozen Four for the first time in program history

¬†

As always, if you have any questions, feedback, or concerns please reach out to us via email, Instagram, or LinkedIn. We are always happy to help answer any questions you may have.


See you all April 7th!

</center>

item.title: BUSAG Newsletter Vol 3
item.description:
3 min.

<center>

Club Updates and General Meetings

Hello everyone! Our upcoming meeting is scheduled for 6:00 on Monday March 3rd, with the room information to be announced. Keep an eye out for an email and updates on Instagram. We are currently in the process of discussing alternative communication methods to best reach all club members, so more on that in the meeting Monday!

General plans for our meeting this Monday is to once again go over sports news headlines, split into groups once again to further project discussions, and also have mini sports analytics history lesson.

Some more general announcements - the project proposal form is still active, so please fill it out if you come up with any more project ideas! The goal is to get you in your groups and establish a timeline for (hopefully) a presentation at the end of the semester. If you have no coding experience, that is more than okay. Feel free to do a deep dive on a research topic instead! We want you to be able to build your portfolio in a way that best suits your skill set.

We also are still taking applications for those interested in working on the newsletter! Fill out the interest form if you would like to get involved! More to come after spring break.

We are also adding a feedback form to the newsletter. If you have any feedback about the newsletter, the club, the projects, anything at all, please feel free to fill out the feedback form. The form is optionally anonymous and will not collect emails, so do not let that hold you back from providing feedback. We want to hear from you and build a club that people enjoy! Any feedback, good or bad, is appreciated.

Feedback Form
¬†

Sports Headlines

Canada Wins Four Nations Faceoff

Team Canada won the first ever Four Nations Face Off in an overtime winner from Nathan MacKinnon, beating Team USA 3-2. MacKinnon won MVP of the tournament for his performance.

The contest drew 16.1 million viewers, making it ESPN‚Äôs most watched hockey game and Sportsnet‚Äôs second most watched. Canada‚Äôs goalie, Jordan Binnington, led the tournament with most high danger saves with 29 throughout the tournament. ¬†


MLB Spring Training Is Underway

February 22nd marked the start of spring training for MLB teams in Arizona and Florida. Some stand out performances include Juan Soto, who just signed a record-breaking deal with the New York Mets. He homered his first at bat against the Houston Astros. National League Cy Young Award winner Chris Sale threw two perfect innings against the Twins.

Opening day for the MLB is March 18th, with the LA Dodgers taking on the Chicago Cubs in Tokyo, Japan to play in the Tokyo Dome.

¬†

Internships and More

Here are some internships and other interesting opportunities for you to check out!:

Jersey Shore BlueClaws Ticketing and Sponsorship Data Analytics Internship: Sports Management ‚Äì Tickets & Sponsorship Data and Analytics Internship - Jersey Shore BlueClaws | TeamWork Online

Prospect Select Baseball Data Analytics Internship (Southeast): Data Analytics Internship - Southeast - Prospect Select Baseball | TeamWork Online

Detroit Lions Football Systems Intern: Football Systems Summer Intern - Detroit Lions | TeamWork Online

Oklahoma City Thunder Fan Insights and Engagement Associate: Fan Insights & Engagement Associate

Indiana Pacers Basketball Operations Intern: Basketball Operations Intern - Summer 2025 - Pacers Sports & Entertainment | TeamWork Online


BU Alumni Sports Analytics Panel: (10) BU Alumni in Sports: Executive Panel (ALL BU) | Handshake (Hosted by BUSBC)

MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference: 2025 Conference - MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference - Check out some of the live streamed talks and take a look at the speaker panels and projects!

¬†

We look forward to seeing you all on Monday! Once again, feel free to email with any questions or concerns at busportsanalytics@bu.edu, Instagram @busportsanalytics, or even LinkedIn @ BU Sports Analytics Group.

</center>

item.title: BUSAG Newsletter Issue 2
item.description:
2 min.

<center>

BUSAG Announcements

Hey everyone! Hope you all are enjoying the long weekend. We wanted to let you guys know that our second meeting is officially scheduled for Tuesday February 18th at 6:00pm in HAR418 (Questrom) - please let us know if you‚Äôre unable to attend. A meeting recap and slides will be sent out for those who cannot make it. We‚Äôre going to start throwing out project ideas and start talking in small groups!

We have also linked a proposal form in the button below. This form is for you to input any analytics project ideas you may have, fully fleshed out or not, so that we can start to brainstorm as a collective group. Feel free to submit as many proposals as you would like. The goal of this form is to help put together like minded individuals interested in the same sport and help you build upon ideas you‚Äôre excited about. If you don‚Äôt have any ideas yet - that‚Äôs okay! Thats what the general meeting is for.

Looking forward to seeing you all Tuesday!

Project Proposal Form
¬†

Sports Headlines

BU Men‚Äôs Hockey Win Their 32nd Title In The 2025 Beanpot!

The Terriers defeated Boston College 4-1 during regulation in the Beanpot championship game on Monday to take home the trophy. Goals were scored by Svoboda (1), C. Huston (1), Eiserman (1), and McCarthy (1). Combined shot count totaled 88 shots, with freshman goalie Mikhail Yegorov putting stop to 43 of 44 shots faced. Yegorov won the Eberly trophy for highest save % (69/71) in the tournament and Cole Huston took home MVP for finishing the tournament with two assists and three goals.

This is BU‚Äôs first beanpot win since 2022.

Philadelphia Eagles Win Super Bowl LIX

In a rematch of Super Bowl LVII, the Eagles dominated the Kansas City Chiefs in a 40-22 win on Sunday in New Orleans and denied KC the three-peat. Jalen Hurts had 221 passing and 72 rushing yards, throwing two TDs and rushing for a third, earning him the MVP title. Patrick Mahomes and the Chief‚Äôs offense struggled, throwing a pick 6 to rookie Cooper DeJean and had six sacks allowed.

Jalen Hurts beat his previous record for most rushing yards by a QB (previous was 70) with a new record of 72 yds. Hurts is also the first QB to ever record 10+ passing and 10+ rushing touchdowns in a playoff career. Saquon Barkley broke the record for most rushing yards in a single season (including post season) with 2,504 yards. ¬†

This was the Eagles second Super Bowl win in franchise history (first was in 2018).

¬†

Opportunities:

Here‚Äôs a list put together for those interesting in interning with a sports organization this summer, and any other interesting opportunities to apply for!


Green Bay Packers Business Analytics:

Business Analytics Intern - Green Bay Packers | TeamWork Online

Chicago City SC Summer Internship Program:

2025 Club Summer Internship Program - Chicago City SC | TeamWork Online

Denver Broncos Strategy & Business Intelligence Internship:

Job Application for Strategy & Business Intelligence Intern - Summer at Denver Broncos and Stadium Management Company

Las Vegas Raiders Internship:

2025 Summer Internship Program - Sports Business Ventures

UCLA Athletic Performance Internship with Olympic Sports:

Athletic Performance Internship Summer-Fall 2025 - Sports Business Ventures

PWHL New York Sirens Job Shadowing Program:

Form - *Over Spring break, for women ages 20+

¬†

</center>

item.title: BUSAG Newsletter Issue 1
item.description:
1 min.

<center>

Welcome to Boston University‚Äôs First

Sports Analytics Group!


Thank you for joining us at our first meeting! If you couldn‚Äôt attend, no worries‚Äîstay tuned for event updates on Instagram. Also please don‚Äôt forget to fill out our interest form (link at the bottom of the page). We‚Äôd love to hear your ideas and feedback on what you want to see from us!


We‚Äôre excited to announce our first event in collaboration with the BU Sports Business Club: A Super Bowl Watch Party (RSVP using link) on February 9th! Join us to watch the Philadelphia Eagles take on the Kansas City Chiefs in New Orleans. The event will feature a live game stream, catered food, and fun games with prizes. Keep an eye on Instagram for the official location announcement‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss it!


Our next meeting is tentatively planned for Tuesday, February 18th, with the location still to be determined. Stay up to date by following us on Instagram (@bu_sportsanalytics), where we‚Äôll post the latest updates, or look out for our next newsletter with more details.

Sign Up/Interest Form

We also wanted to share with you The Official BU SAG Guide to the 2025 Beanpot! It‚Äôs full of everything you would want to know about the game next Monday, February 3rd and Monday, February 10th at TD Garden. If you haven‚Äôt gotten your tickets yet, follow @budogpound for information on how to grab last minute tickets (they will also post any game day info for both dates). ¬†

Go Terriers!

For those of you who were unable to attend our first meeting (EVER!) we have attached the slides here so you can get to know our e-board and see what we have coming up! If you have any questions about any of the information, please feel free to reach out to us either via email, Instagram, or through one of our board members.

First Meeting Slides

Looking forward to seeing everyone at the next event!

¬†

</center>
